results.title: How Shang-Chi, Master of Kung Fu, Knocked Down Stereotypes
results.abstract: The Marvel superhero originated in comics filled with racist tropes. The creators of the new film made a list of the preconceptions they were up against and set out to conquer them.

results.title: Mikis Theodorakis, ‘Zorba’ Composer and Marxist Rebel, Dies at 96
results.abstract: Known for his film music, he also waged a war of words and music against a military junta that banned his work and imprisoned him during its rule of Greece.
des_facet: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

multimedia.caption: The Greek composer and political activist Mikis Theodorakis at the United Nations in 1970. He was best known internationally for his scores for the films “Zorba the Greek,” “Z” and “Serpico.”

results.title: Turner Classic Movies Is Changing. And Trying to Stay the Same.
results.abstract: A brand refresh for TCM, the cable home to countless vintage films, raises questions about its future within an increasingly streaming-centric TV world.

multimedia.caption: Turner Classic Movies has undertaken a makeover, not a change of mission. But the host Ben Mankiewicz, left, with Ava DuVernay, still thinks loyal fans “are going to have a small heart attack.”
multimedia.copyright: Anne Marie Fox/TCM, via Associated Press

results.title: Rachael Leigh Cook Was Always Worth the Bet
results.abstract: After more than 25 years in Hollywood, the star of millennial classics like “She’s All That” and “Josie and the Pussycats” is ready for a new chapter.

multimedia.caption: Rachael Leigh Cook in Beverly Hills this summer. “I’m a lifer. I’ve been around the block,” she said. “It used to be so not OK for a woman to even get older. Now, I’m older and somehow it’s OK.”
multimedia.copyright: Amy Harrity for The New York Times
